summary: This is a confidential memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated July 23, 2019, reporting an incident involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It describes staff finding Epstein in his cell with a piece of handmade orange cloth around his neck in the early morning hours, prompting an emergency response and the securing of his cellmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found in his cell with a piece of handmade orange cloth around his neck, requiring emergency staff assistance.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was secured in the bathroom with restraints applied during the emergency response to Epstein.

connections.description: They were sharing cell Z05-124 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center when the incident occurred.

events.title: Epstein Found with Cloth Around Neck in Cell
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, staff in the Special Housing Unit heard noises and found inmate Jeffrey Epstein lying near his bunk with a piece of handmade orange cloth around his neck, prompting an emergency response.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: The incident involving Jeffrey Epstein occurred on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM in the Special Housing Unit of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein was found lying near his bunk with a piece of handmade orange cloth around his neck, which prompted an immediate call for staff assistance.
Epstein's cellmate, inmate Tartaglione, was restrained and secured in the bathroom while staff provided assistance to Epstein.
The document is marked CONFIDENTIAL and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files related to Epstein.
